body.p: A day or two ago I signed a petition to have Reuben S. Darnall up Commissioned to raise a Company of active militia in this County under your Call for state troops. Since then I have learned some things which satisfies me that the appointment would be injudicious, at least I would advise or request you to hold the appointment up, until you hear further about the matter. We are getting along here very well and there appears to be a scattering of the rebels & guerillas at present, that will in this part of the state, at least, do away with the necessity of Calling out a Company from this County. And, should there be a necessity, I think our worthy Mayor Can be induced to take Charge of a Company and if he will, he will give more entire Satisfaction and security to the people. Mr Darnall, I think, too young for such an important position besides, he has been Connected I understood with negro recruiting, which you know would to a great extent paralyze his usefullness

To His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette Gov. Ky.

Maysville, Mason Co. Ky.
May 9, 1865
Cochran, R. A.
To Govenor.

Writes that he signed a petition petition some time since, recommending Reuben S. Darnall as a suitable person to raise a company of Active Militia, but thinks now that the appointment would be injudicious, and suggests that it be withheld as guerillas are disbanding, don't think it necessary to have a company in Mason.
